item.title: ASR Under the Stethoscope: Evaluating Biases in Clinical Speech Recognition across Indian Languages
item.description: arXiv:2512.10967v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) is increasingly used to document clinical encounters, yet its reliability in multilingual and demographically diverse Indian healthcare contexts remains largely unknown. In this study, we conduct the first systematic...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> context, analysis, study, model, arxiv | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Benchmarking Automatic Speech Recognition Models for African Languages
item.description: arXiv:2512.10968v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Automatic speech recognition (ASR) for African languages remains constrained by limited labeled data and the lack of systematic guidance on model selection, data scaling, and decoding strategies. item.description: arXiv:2512.11074v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Multi30k is frequently cited in the multimodal machine translation (MMT) literature, offering parallel text data for training and fine-tuning deep learning models.
